definition: photobook (loanword from Japanese), generally sexy portraits of an actress or model
to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode

sentences.english: Amber and the staffs coordinate their efforts to issue the new photo album.
sentences.chinese: 郭采潔和工作人員齊心協力，爲了推出新的寫真集。

sentences.english: Well, you all know I'm working on my photo album.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，你們都知道我正在進行我的寫真集。

sentences.english: At Hong Fan's home I saw a lot of her self-took realistic pictures.
sentences.chinese: 在洪帆的家裏我見到了大量她爲做作品自拍的寫真集。

sentences.english: Your shot autograph meeting at the exhibition was in the news a lot these days.
sentences.chinese: 你的寫真集展覽一直是這幾天的新聞。

sentences.english: Richard:Well, you all know I'm working on my photo album.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，你們都知道我正在進行我的寫真集。

definition: Formosa (from Ilha Formosa, "Beautiful Isle", the name given to Taiwan Island by passing Portuguese mariners in 1544)
to rush (to do sth urgent)/to try to be the first/to forestall
to call for entries and select the best/to solicit (entries, submissions, applications etc)/to select (the best candidate)/contest/competition
to be a big hit/to be hugely popular
news from behind the scenes/stage gossip
